events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision incident that occurred on the morning of April 30th. Initial details were collected to begin the claim process.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the keywords related to the car collision and damages reported.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to facilitate communication and assist the customer through the claims process.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps for the investigation.
The customer was asked to submit the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a copy of the insurance policy for processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos, police report, and repair estimates to support the claim.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted materials and contacted witnesses to verify the circumstances of the accident.
Investigation concluded confirming the liability of the third party and validating the reported damages to the insured vehicle.
A settlement offer was made to the customer covering repair costs and rental reimbursement while the vehicle is being fixed.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the quick handling and transparency of the claims process so far.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the settlement offer and validation of all required documents.
Payment covering all agreed settlement amounts including repairs and additional expenses was issued to the customer.
The insurance claim file was closed after confirmation of payment receipt and assurance that customer concerns were fully addressed.
The claim documentation and case records were securely archived in the company system for future reference if needed.
